column4: hey guys, what do us linux ppl use to build flash pages like macromedia mx or swish?
ktoon can do it apparently, theres also a cli tool that makes swf files from animated gifs
sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-96   i think (if you use karmic)
yes it affects linux users, the 64bit plugin in the recommended repo is still 10.0 but as long as you keep to reputable pages you will be fine
there are also addons for various browser which let you too
use the universal installer in windows to transfer the iso to usb
you dont just copy the iso to the device, its needs transferring in a special way
if you have a windows PC then pendrivelinux have a universal ISO copier, Ubuntu has usb-creator-gtk  which can transfer the iso over so it is bootable
not used kde for years now. The guys in #kubuntu will see them daily
doesn't matter, maverick is offtopic here
there seems to be a command antiword which converts word files to text
usually they figure themselves out. If you made an xorg.conf file, it is located in /etc/X11
